name: Marie Skłodowska Curie
note: in recognition of the extraordinary services they have rendered by their joint researches on the radiation phenomena discovered by Professor Henri Becquerel

name: Bertha von Suttner
note: Honorary President of Permanent International Peace Bureau, Bern, Switzerland; Author of Lay Down Your Arms.

name: Selma Lagerlöf
note: in appreciation of the lofty idealism, vivid imagination and spiritual perception that characterize her writings

name: Marie Skłodowska Curie
note: for her discovery of radium and polonium

name: Grazia Deledda
note: for her idealistically inspired writings which with plastic clarity picture the life on her native island and with depth and sympathy deal with human problems in general

name: Sigrid Undset
note: principally for her powerful descriptions of Northern life during the Middle Ages

name: Jane Addams
note: Sociologist; International President, Women's International League for Peace and Freedom.

name: Irène Joliot-Curie
note: for their synthesis of new radioactiveelements

name: Pearl S. Buck
note: for her rich and truly epic descriptions of peasant life in China and for her biographical masterpieces

name: Gabriela Mistral
note: for her lyric poetry which, inspired by powerful emotions, has made her name a symbol of the idealistic aspirations of the entire Latin American world

name: Emily Greene Balch
note: Formerly Professor of History and Sociology; Honorary International President, Women's International League for Peace and Freedom.

name: Gerty Theresa Cori
note: for their discovery of the course of the catalytic conversion of glycogen

name: Maria Goeppert-Mayer
note: for their discoveries concerning nuclear shell structure

name: Dorothy Crowfoot Hodgkin
note: for her determinations by X-ray techniques of the structures of important biochemical substances

name: Nelly Sachs
note: for her outstanding lyrical and dramatic writing, which interprets Israel's destiny with touching strength

name: Betty Williams
note: Founder of the Northern Ireland Peace Movement (later renamed Community of Peace People)

name: Mairead Maguire
note: Founder of the Northern Ireland Peace Movement (later renamed Community of Peace People)

name: Rosalyn Sussman Yalow
note: for the development of radioimmunoassays of peptide hormones

name: Mother Teresa
note: Leader of Missionaries of Charity, Calcutta.

name: Alva Myrdal
note: Former Cabinet Minister; Diplomat; Writer.

name: Barbara McClintock
note: for her discovery of mobile genetic elements

name: Rita Levi-Montalcini
note: for their discoveries of growth factors

name: Gertrude B. Elion
note: for their discoveries of important principles for drug treatment

name: Nadine Gordimer
note: who through her magnificent epic writing has - in the words of Alfred Nobel - been of very great benefit to humanity

name: Aung San Suu Kyi
note: for her non-violent struggle for democracy and human rights

name: Rigoberta Menchú
note: in recognition of her work for social justice and ethno-cultural reconciliation based on respect for the rights of indigenous peoples

name: Toni Morrison
note: who in novels characterized by visionary force and poetic import, gives life to an essential aspect of American reality

name: Christiane Nüsslein-Volhard
note: for their discoveries concerning the genetic control of early embryonic development

name: Wisława Szymborska
note: for poetry that with ironic precision allows the historical and biological context to come to light in fragments of human reality

name: Jody Williams
note: for their work for the banning and clearing of anti-personnel mines

name: Shirin Ebadi
note: for her efforts for democracy and human rights. She has focused especially on the struggle for the rights of women and children

name: Elfriede Jelinek
note: for her musical flow of voices and counter-voices in novels and plays that with extraordinary linguistic zeal reveal the absurdity of society's clichés and their subjugating power

name: Wangari Maathai
note: for her contribution to sustainable development, democracy and peace

name: Linda B. Buck
note: for their discoveries of odorant receptors and the organization of the olfactory system

name: Doris Lessing
note: that epicist of the female experience, who with scepticism, fire and visionary power has subjected a divided civilisation to scrutiny

name: Françoise Barré-Sinoussi
note: for their discovery of HIV, human immunodeficiency virus

name: Elizabeth Blackburn
note: for the discovery of how chromosomes are protected by telomeres and the enzyme telomerase

name: Carol W. Greider
note: for the discovery of how chromosomes are protected by telomeres and the enzyme telomerase

name: Ada E. Yonath
note: for studies of the structure and function of the ribosome

name: Herta Müller
note: who, with the concentration of poetry and the frankness of prose, depicts the landscape of the dispossessed

name: Elinor Ostrom
note: for her analysis of economic governance, especially the commons

name: Ellen Johnson Sirleaf
note: For their non-violent struggle for the safety of women and for women's rights to full participation in peace-building work

name: Leymah Gbowee
note: For their non-violent struggle for the safety of women and for women's rights to full participation in peace-building work

name: Tawakel Karman
note: For their non-violent struggle for the safety of women and for women's rights to full participation in peace-building work

name: Alice Munro
note: master of the contemporary short story

name: May-Britt Moser
note: for their discoveries of cells that constitute a positioning system in the brain

name: Malala Yousafzai
note: for their struggle against the suppression of children and young people and for the right of all children to education

name: Tu Youyou
note: for her discoveries concerning a novel therapy against Malaria

name: Svetlana Alexievich
note: for her polyphonic writings, a monument to suffering and courage in our time

name: Donna Strickland
note: for their method of generating high-intensity, ultra-short optical pulses

name: Frances Arnold
note: for the directed evolution of enzymes

name: Nadia Murad
note: for their efforts to end the use of sexual violence as a weapon of war and armed conflict
